de.wwu.muggl.vm.classfile.support
Class BytecodeParser

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.vm.classfile.support.BytecodeParser

public class BytecodeParser
extends java.lang.Object

The ByteCodeParser offers static methods for the parsing on unsigned byes (represented by shorts here). It supplies back an Instruction holding initialized object of the instruction read from the bytecode.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-10
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

          Protected default constructor.

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

parse

public static Instruction parse(short byteCodeInstruction)
                         throws InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Parses an unsigned byte to an Instruction without a look at the code and while ignoring the current line. This might lead to problems with a couple of the instructions. Especially loading of further bytes is not possible (many instructions have one or more additional bytes).

Parameters:
byteCodeInstruction - The unsigned byte as a short.
Returns:
A properly initialized Instruction.
Throws:
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - Any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization will lead to this exception.

parse

public static Instruction parse(short byteCodeInstruction,
                                AttributeCode code,
                                int currentLine)
                         throws InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Parses an unsigned byte to an Instruction, supplying further needed data to the classes for the instructions.

Parameters:
byteCodeInstruction - The unsigned byte as a short.
code - The AttributeCode this instruction is taken from.
currentLine - The "line" in the method this instruction is at.
Returns:
A properly initialized Instruction.
Throws:
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - Any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization will lead to this exception.
